channel.title: Coding in general PLEASE READ!
channel.description:
Well like some tutorials say, declare this code into player.java
[code]public int example[/code]
Where do I put it? Like towards the beginning? End? Middle? I don't understand it, I like HTML a lot because it can be messy as fuck and its not case sensitive.

item.title: Coding in general PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Well if you’re going to declare it inside a method, you won’t be able to call it from outside that method … you also have to declare it after the “class” and before the final bracket
But ya just place it anywhere and you should be ok…

Read full topic

item.title: Coding in general PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“DynastyRSPS, post:3, topic:384061”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=479819.msg3512923#msg3512923 date=1298736309]
Most values go towards the beginning of the code, not above the imports or the class name. There should be other values, simply slot it in near them.

e.g

//imports etc

public class test
{

  int x = 1;
  int z = 6;
  //slot your value around here
//more code etc
 }

[size=8pt]inb4indentationl2convevtionstupdifag[/size]
[/quote]

Oh so basically I’d search for int’s then insert it somewhere by it?[/quote]

Look, it doesn’t really matter where you declare a value, but it’s neater to put them all in one place so you can find them easily for future reference.

Read full topic
